Key Match Events: West Indies defeated Papua New Guinea by five wickets in their T20 World Cup 2024 opener.
Roston Chase scored an unbeaten 42 runs off 27 balls.
Assad Vala took two wickets for PNG.
Alzarri Joseph took three wickets for West Indies.
Rain interrupted play during the match.
West Indies needed 13 runs in the last 12 balls and successfully chased the target.
Andre Russell hit the winning run for West Indies.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies won the toss and chose to field first.
The pitch report indicated favorable conditions for batting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in Georgetown.
This was the tournament opener for both teams.
